document.title: Tennessee Academic Standards for Fine Arts

FA3001E708444FB988E8CB6A13F6A4C0.description:
Present and support an opinion about the social, cultural, and
historical understandings of a theatrical work, based on criticalresearch.

6DE78DB01C46473891DBC8A14D369C2E.description:
Formulate creative choices for a devised or scripted theatrical
work based on research about the selected topic.

554AD78EDEB74821A28989FAE2755CFB.description:
Research and analyze two different versions of the same
theatrical work to determine differences and similarities in the visual and
aural world of each story.

D41F30E47DA54751AFC4172479948FD7.description:
Develop a theatrical work that identifies and questions
cultural, global, and historic belief systems.

6D518F2D92FF4E3D81C09AAB8429AA0C.description:
Explore how cultural, global, and historic belief systems affect
creative choices in a theatrical work.

3CB1BAAACA1E41B09C37A7E8BF374C49.description:
Incorporate music, dance, art, and/or media to strengthenthe
meaning and conflict in a theatrical work with a particular cultural, global, or
historic context.

F5731EECA3224F6088E1D324BAC23E36.description:
Research how other theatre artists apply creative processes
to tell stories in a devised or scripted theatrical work.

AB75CA5E4D6642EA806D18C382A4988F.description:
Integrate conventions and knowledge from different art forms
and other disciplines to develop a cross-cultural theatrical work.

2F7ECD27D98944ED9A3E853BB18CA8D0.description:
Use different forms of theatrical work to examine
contemporary social, cultural, or global issues.

CBBF54A9669F49D29079299E88AD0B7F.description:
Identify universal themes or common social issues, and
express them through a theatrical work.

6D1B5CDBBF004DA4A3E5172978008FE7.description:
Investigate historical, global, and social issues expressed in
theatrical work.

052D9E9E72314D668B7D8828DFA73E0B.description: Relate artistic ideas and works with societal, cultural, and historical text.

7AC7219A0EA043AAB6328F2F3F825CB1.description:
Collaborate on a theatrical work that examines a criticalglobal
issue using multiple personal, community, and culturalperspectives.

B41331AF47A24BFAA5A178E84D57A757.description:
Investigate how cultural perspectives, community ideas, and
personal beliefs impact a theatrical work.

25E4D199876145D19D0281BCA2E96E76.description:
Incorporate multiple perspectives and diverse community
ideas in a theatrical work.

149A5490DD594797BFFB539372C44126.description:
Explore how cultural, global, and historic belief systems affect
creative choices in a theatrical work.

844854E2568144C6BB1E7FA831E6040B.description:
Develop a theatrical work that identifies and questions
cultural, global, and historic belief systems.

344DFCB3515B4A5CA258FEF34A996535.description:
Examine a community issue through multiple perspectives in
a theatrical work.

1ED80FF0B1D045BFB0E008AD4E5F940D.description:
Explain how the actions and motivations of characters in a
theatrical work reflect perspectives of a community or culture.

FC5A210508EF41B1B347F63AC2758C21.description:
Investigate how cultural perspectives, community ideas, and
personal beliefs impact a theatrical work.

6EF74BF6B2514294AD5FE7D13175A5FA.description: Synthesize and relate knowledge and personal experiences to artistic endeavors.

D77EB60DE8E14543BD217D1CED4E96AD.description:
Compare and debate the connection between a theatrical work
and contemporary issues that may impact audiences.

D5E42C86810E485889EA3CEC9C29684E.description:
Assess how a theatrical work communicates to a specific
audience for a specific purpose.

1E189C8D0EA34C1091F94BA2F848EF9D.description:
When evaluating a theatrical work, explain preferences using
supporting evidence and criteria.

6FC0A05C1ECB479293F835A9E3D492E5.description:
Analyze and evaluate varied aesthetic interpretations of
production elements for the same theatrical work.

564C3A16E74842DD8E238DA7A7C5E4C5.description:
Construct meaning in a theatrical work, considering personal
aesthetics and knowledge of production elements while respecting others’
interpretations.

C63CF001C02D49FCBEF6CC6BC15E7283.description:
Use knowledge of the production elements to respond to and
assess a theatrical work using supporting evidence, personal aesthetics,
and artistic criteria.

BE4BA125EEDB43CBB31663E7E7C7808A.description:
Investigate and assess how technical elements maysupport
and/or represent a theme or idea in a theatrical work.

E9DFBF640AD34F149E3238F884C8EEB7.description:
Research and synthesize cultural and historical information
related to a theatrical work to support or evaluate artistic choices.

B0C7F412032D4A748C7F3A297CD26B23.description:
Analyze and assess a theatrical work by connecting it to other
art forms, history, culture, and other disciplines using supporting evidence
and artistic criteria.

ACE20B7082B145E5B836D736F1F7D5B7.description:
Identify various ways in which the intended purpose of a
theatrical work appeals to a specific audience.

4AB455122F23492295973B6FF1C41A81.description: Develop and implement a plan to evaluate a theatrical work.

90F2AE56666E4B6DB7324EF48744E45C.description: Apply criteria to evaluate artistic work.

CD72F92F29F742C082D7AEEB7BD50823.description:
Support and explain aesthetics, preferences, and beliefs to
create a context for critical research that informs artistic decisions in a
theatrical work.

9EE18A1AB68A4DC9BDF640C126BE7DC0.description:
Debate and distinguish between multiple aesthetics,
preferences, and beliefs through participation in and observation of
theatrical work.

562F3A16F47E45DDB1C4300107C175DE.description:
Recognize and share ideas about artistic choices when
participating in and/or observing a theatrical work.

220D082EB3424C3780846B812A6B6A56.description:
Use new understandings of cultures and contexts to shape
personal responses to theatrical work.

A86C91C2FAAD4C2A83F556E7C0E50E5B.description:
Apply concepts from a theatrical work for personal realization
about cultural perspectives and understanding of those perspectives.

C975BFE2CC7B4EFBB7CFAF4DBC2C24AA.description:
Analyze, compare, and contrast artistic choices developed from
personal experiences in multiple theatrical works.

FDF398BCA5824A8A87F5B7E9A5073E5B.description:
Identify cultural perspectives, personal aesthetics, preferences,
and beliefs that may influence the evaluation of a theatricalwork.

D7A74CC1027146B28C23EA2AAB610AE1.description:
Use detailed supporting evidence and appropriate criteria to
revise personal work and interpret the work of others when participating in
or observing a theatrical work.

DF100FB765CB4C8B87C502F5F42E23C2.description:
Develop detailed supporting evidence and criteria to reinforce
artistic choices when participating in or observing a theatrical work.

A965422FB4AA4416B91E0C51409AC4D7.description:
Investigate the effects of emotions on posture,gesture,
breathing, and vocal intonation in a theatrical work.

E3CAA049C9A6494E904D82C24B4264D1.description:
Consider multiple ways to develop a character using physical
characteristics and prop and/or costume design choices that reflect cultural
perspectives in theatrical work.

A1B138C7F4224F26AFB1292DE539A0B4.description: Interpret intent and meaning in artistic work.

B3C707589F9D40798AA8A9FEC7E527A8.description:
Analyze, assess, and critique peer work using artistic criteria
and knowledge of various production and performance elements.

4640B918570946DEB8F405FF79FAADC5.description:
Analyze and assess peer work using artistic criteria and
knowledge of various production and performance elements.

708AA2800A404DD28E2CE4BB63CF7EFF.description:
Respond to and evaluate what is seen, felt, and heard during a
theatrical work to develop criteria for artistic choices.

5CE777987F52444AA1BC81AF5AE923CA.description:
Using participation and observation, describe and explain
personal reactions to artistic choices made in a theatrical work.

75471D5B84704B3F828D612849E17B36.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of multiple interpretationsof
artistic criteria and how each might be used to influence future artistic
choices of a theatrical work.

723A3874DF3A45348F50D265B223B07B.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of multiple interpretationsof
artistic criteria and how each might be used to influence future artistic
choices of a theatrical work.

DFC8F5BE9E214742B213E75D655727B9.description:
Apply criteria to the evaluation of artistic choices in a theatrical
work.

A211D3AB730D45C58361AF775643D44B.description:
Using participation and/or observation, identify artistic choices
made in a theatrical work.

E66BABC1ED894CE4B3F854EC0876E025.description:
Re-imagine and revise technical design choices and apply a
high level of technical proficiencies during the course of a rehearsal process
to enhance the story and emotional impact of a devised or scripted
theatrical work.

8648B5C0C55D4725B2AD26030E960BFD.description:
Conceptualize and construct technical design choices to
enhance the story and emotional impact of a devised or scripted theatrical
work (e.g., lighting, sound, scenery, props, costumes, makeup).

21FE4574A9FC4849AED2773816F2C70A.description:
Cooperate as a creative team to implement and refine a
planned technical design using technology during the rehearsal processfor
devised or scripted theatrical work.

4C64FB353EBF414C95551FA7D794AF96.description:
Explore and use physical, vocal, and/or psychological traits to
develop a performance that is believable, authentic, and relevant to a
theatrical work.

8ABBAB074F2A4776B61993879D8FB006.description:
Use research and script analysis to revise physical, vocal, and
physiological choices impacting the believability and relevance of a theatrical work, as well as to demonstrate a critical understanding of
historical and cultural influences.

9A1D85B1C5D44D03948EDCC2014E31D0.description:
Research, analyze, and demonstrate effective physical, vocal
and physiological choices to develop a believable, authentic, and relevant
performance in a theatrical work.

979E3617AD144A6AAB76592869CF139C.description:
Devise and refine a dramatic concept to demonstrate a critical
understanding of historical and cultural influences of original ideas applied
to a theatrical work.

76FEBC7125DF41B0A3430DCEB1AAAFBF.description:
Revise and improve an improvised or scripted theatrical work
through repetition, collaboration, and self-review.

ADAE42074785417ABC5D8CA66A357455.description:
Use the rehearsal process to analyze the dramatic concept
and technical design elements of a devised or scripted theatrical work and
to refine, transform, and re-imagine a devised or scripted theatrical work to
invent or re-imagine style, genre, form, and conventions.

1B7B43850D504BADA9A525AAAB2680C6.description:
Analyze and critique the dramatic concept of a devised or
scripted theatrical work.

21A2940420D047CC9F967D67DE56E9B4.description:
Practice and demonstrate a devised or scripted theatrical work
using theatrical staging (blocking, movement).

3C4EEAC5ED8A43058D8398C67534A372.description:
Create and implement design solutions for a theatrical work
which support the story and given circumstance.

60B0C5AD11CB40539A1A5DFA7631545C.description:
Collaborate as a creative team to discover artistic solutions
and make interpretive choices in a devised or scripted theatrical work.

F38769337ABE47D296B4E5CB09C3BDC6.description:
Develop and refine a dramatic concept or character to
demonstrate a critical understanding of the historical and cultural influences
of original ideas applied to a theatrical work.

98D4CEA7EF234FE0AEF8B020515769C3.description:
Cooperate as a creative team to make interpretive choices for
a theatrical work.

DA1101FDD77F4A72B5244E5689ED26C1.description:
Examine and justify original ideas and artistic choices in a
theatrical work based on critical analysis, background knowledge, and/or
historical and cultural context.

BC39DC14543C431EB54BD6C897042294.description:
Develop and synthesize original ideas in a theatrical work
utilizing critical analysis, historical and cultural context, research, and
western or non-western theatre traditions.

B55E597BDE70453A8EF5D47825EAE02B.description:
Use critical analysis of original ideas to explore the functionof
history and culture in the development of a dramatic concept in a theatrical
work.

80139DFC841141D6A956DDCD100E8647.description:
Devise and refine a dramatic concept to demonstrate a critical
understanding of historical and/or cultural influences of original ideas
applied to a theatrical work.

658F41B7909D48CE917B3A744D7AB5C9.description:
Collaborate with peers as the actor, director, playwright,
designer, etc. in preparing or devising theatrical work.

10130B7684B34D2994184989F9C10CDC.description: Organize and develop artistic ideas and work.

5465D3E3E1184BB09982652458ED89B9.description:
Integrate cultural and historical contexts with personal
experiences to create a believable and authentic character in atheatrical
work.

7F86E62605CF448BB1BB4BD3CAB4AFB7.description:
Integrate cultural and historical contexts with personal
experiences to create a character that is believable and authentic in a
theatrical work.

A97C16B43E974BBC9FB5DEB30DE8AD69.description:
Use personal experiences and background knowledge to
develop a character that is believable and authentic in a theatricalwork.

4DF3E7F38C194848A55556936CDB85DB.description:
Use script analysis to generate ideas about a character that is
believable and authentic in a theatrical work.

C0DD9662E2784D5B85ABEF38464BBF65.description:
Design and implement a complete design for a theatrical work
that incorporates all elements of technology necessary for a production
(e.g., lighting, scenery, sound, props, costumes, makeup, etc.).

412EFD49EEAE4600A09CBCEC0D938708.description:
Design and implement a design for a theatrical work that
incorporates multiple elements of technology. (e.g., lighting, scenery, sound,
props, costumes, and makeup).

173D4230CD6040A2A73E3F533FB624C0.description:
Create and justify technical design choices which support the
story and emotional impact of a theatrical work and which incorporate
multiple elements of technology.

AC2521A0F27D4A0A936ECCBC7454B8FE.description:
Apply basic research to construct ideas about the visual
composition and technical elements (e.g., costumes, props, sets, etc.) of a
theatrical work.

11F8967599444E169AA695A3228551A7.description:
Synthesize knowledge from a variety of dramatic forms,
theatrical conventions, and technologies, including rights and royalties to
create the visual composition of a theatrical work.

A827B9C3C56645D38CB99F6E97B7984A.description:
Conduct and apply basic research to construct ideas about the
visual composition of a theatrical work.

486D759FBBAA4E1A948D6409BB29892E.description:
Investigate historical and/or cultural conventions and their
impact on the visual composition of a theatrical work.

CDE4C6D3EB0B4F26990B1BE70CC03044.description:
Create roles, imagined worlds, and improvised stories in a
theatrical work.

53D851A2387549D7AB8F1A5B5D55B06C.description: Generate and conceptualize artistic ideas and work.

7ACE8706FA1F447F9DA31D082991E9B0.description: Conduct research to make directorial choices for a production.

E743D84EBD8D4940AA0CC999D899FF8A.description:
Create performance for a specific stage type (proscenium,
thrust, etc.).

1EDA2FF723D343E8BF2CA24EE8F4859C.description:
Adapt performance for a specific stage type (proscenium,
thrust, etc.) based upon knowledge of stage styles.

C48085069F6A419FACFFDD3952AC0490.description:
Present a theatrical production for a specific audience that
employs research and analysis grounded in the creative perspectives of the
playwright, director, designer, and dramaturge.

83A995AAE958496480C65BAE117DC91E.description:
Present a theatrical work for a specific audience using creative
processes that shape the production.

7B8437A608E44DFBBCB2799CC14436B9.description: Perform a scripted theatrical work for a specific audience.

E8F40E7E7F7642D1A110F14FC1657993.description: Perform a rehearsed theatrical work for an audience.

80431060F10341E0AD96DD7A20FA070B.description: Express meaning through the performance of artistic work.

313C0C0382194C20950700FAF627CCD5.description:
Explain and justify the selection of multiple technical elements
used to build a design that communicates the concept of a theatrical work.

AF116B7526854A21A50B913E8F7504FE.description:
Apply multiple technical elements and research to create a
design that communicates the concept and theme of a theatrical work.

8D58305265D94A9783017435FBB68820.description:
Use multiple researched technical elements to increase the
impact of design in a theatrical work.

422498B1204E469E8C9754DC84A73552.description:
Select and apply specific technical elements to create a design
for a theatrical work.

440ED631B5CC46A0983F4C975D335078.description:
Apply and justify a collection of acting techniques from reliable
resources to prepare a believable and sustainable performance.

3A680713796841B6ADAA000B7CCEF7E2.description:
Refine a range of acting skills to build a believable and
sustainable character in theatrical work.

8830CDE245AD4B1088D0C6FE34A1339E.description:
Use a variety of acting techniques to expand skills in a
rehearsal or theatrical performance.

67C3638E262144DDB5B88BAFD28AB409.description:
Demonstrate various acting techniques in a rehearsal or
scripted theatrical work.

B2689852B0EA46C5908ADEFE9950611E.description: Develop and refine artistic techniques and work for performance.

D31BD4735D0D4D1FBCAAE72737B16278.description:
Apply a variety of researched acting techniques to character
choices in a theatrical work.

ECB5CD87F0064CA7814575C641EE02B5.description:
Identify essential text information, research from various
sources, and the director’s concepts that influence character choices, and
apply those in a theatrical work.

26F8CD9DB37842689A32ACA89615BB38.description:
Explore uses of various pacing techniques to better
communicate the story in a theatrical work.

95351E0048164A1D987D55D150D12FDD.description:
Apply reliable research of directors’ styles to influence and
make unique choices for a directorial concept in a theatrical work.

122A5988FE4B487A87F5E05F48D165B1.description:
Analyze and apply unique choices to create believable and
sustainable characters in a theatrical work.

5C5CDED141A5487398EBF39473466AA5.description:
Use researched character objectives and tactics in a theatrical
work to overcome an obstacle.

05A074DF645D4B6AB8D7E3856DE7E0BE.description: Perform an improvised theatrical work for an audience.

86749C4DD8564E928975FE4DCB3FAB88.description: Select, analyze, and interpret artistic work for performance.
